books.name: Dune
books.author: Frank Herbert
books.description: Set in the distant future amidst a feudal interstellar society in which noble houses, in control of individual planets, owe allegiance to the Padishah Emperor, Dune tells the story of young Paul Atreides, whose noble family accepts the stewardship of the desert planet Arrakis.

books.name: Foundation
books.author: Isaac Asimov
books.description: The story is set on the planet Foundation, a world at the periphery of the Galactic Empire. Hari Seldon, a mathematician and psychologist, has developed psychohistory, a new field of science and psychology that equates all possibilities in large societies to mathematics, allowing for the prediction of future events.

books.name: Ender's Game
books.author: Orson Scott Card
books.description: The novel takes place in Earth's future where mankind has barely survived two conflicts with the Formics, an insectoid alien species that are usually called 'Buggers'. In preparation for an anticipated third invasion, children, including the novel's protagonist, Ender Wiggin, are trained from a very young age through increasingly difficult games including some in zero gravity, where Ender's tactical genius is revealed.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: The novel is set in the year 1984 when most of the world population have become victims of perpetual war, omnipresent government surveillance and public manipulation.

books.name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: The broad narrative of Hitchhiker follows the misadventures of the last surviving man, Arthur Dent, following the demolition of the Earth by a Vogon constructor fleet to make way for a hyperspace bypass.

books.name: Neuromancer
books.author: William Gibson
books.description: The novel tells the story of a washed-up computer hacker hired by a mysterious employer to pull off the ultimate hack.

books.name: The War of the Worlds
books.author: H.G. Wells
books.description: The novel is the first-person narrative of both an unnamed protagonist in Surrey and of his younger brother in London as southern England is invaded by Martians.

books.name: Snow Crash
books.author: Neal Stephenson
books.description: The story follows Hiro Protagonist, a hacker and pizza delivery driver in the futuristic United States. Hiro becomes embroiled in a conflict between the Metaverse, a virtual reality-based successor to the Internet, and an ancient and powerful virtual reality entity.

books.name: The Martian
books.author: Andy Weir
books.description: The story follows an American astronaut, Mark Watney, as he becomes stranded alone on Mars in 2035 and must improvise in order to survive.

books.name: Starship Troopers
books.author: Robert A. Heinlein
books.description: The story follows a young soldier named Juan Rico and his exploits in the Mobile Infantry, a futuristic military service branch equipped with powered armor.

books.name: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: The novel presents a futuristic World State, where citizens are environmentally engineered into an intelligence-based social hierarchy.

books.name: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.description: Set in a near-future New England, in a totalitarian state resembling a theonomy, the novel explores themes of women in subjugation in a patriarchal society and the various means by which they gain agency.

books.name: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.description: The novel presents a future American society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

books.name: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.description: The story of a father and his young son, journeying across a barren, post-apocalyptic landscape, struggling to survive.

books.name: The Left Hand of Darkness
books.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
books.description: The novel follows an envoy from Earth who is sent to the planet Gethen, where inhabitants can change gender, to facilitate its inclusion in a growing interplanetary alliance.

books.name: A Canticle for Leibowitz
books.author: Walter M. Miller Jr.
books.description: Set in a Catholic monastery in the desert of the southwestern United States after a devastating nuclear war, the novel spans thousands of years as civilization rebuilds itself.

books.name: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.description: The novel tells the story of Rick Deckard, a bounty hunter of androids, as he navigates through a post-apocalyptic world.

books.name: Altered Carbon
books.author: Richard K. Morgan
books.description: Set in a future where consciousness can be transferred to different bodies, the novel follows a former soldier investigating a rich man's apparent suicide.

books.name: Old Man's War
books.author: John Scalzi
books.description: In a future where the elderly can join the military and receive rejuvenated bodies, the novel follows John Perry, who enlists on his 75th birthday.

books.name: Ringworld
books.author: Larry Niven
books.description: The novel follows a team of explorers as they investigate a massive ring-shaped structure in space.

books.name: The Moon is a Harsh Mistress
books.author: Robert A. Heinlein
books.description: The story of a lunar colony's revolt against the government of Earth.

books.name: I, Robot
books.author: Isaac Asimov
books.description: A collection of short stories about robots and the future of humanity.

books.name: Snow Crash
books.author: Neal Stephenson
books.description: In the future United States, a computer virus called Snow Crash is capable of infecting humans. The story follows Hiro Protagonist, a pizza delivery driver and computer hacker.

books.name: The Dispossessed
books.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
books.description: The story of a physicist named Shevek who attempts to build a bridge between two disparate societies.

books.name: Stranger in a Strange Land
books.author: Robert A. Heinlein
books.description: The story of Valentine Michael Smith, a human raised by Martians, and his journey of self-discovery and exploration of human culture.

books.name: Rendezvous with Rama
books.author: Arthur C. Clarke
books.description: The story of a group of explorers sent to intercept and investigate an alien spacecraft passing through the solar system.

books.name: A Fire Upon the Deep
books.author: Vernor Vinge
books.description: The novel follows two stories: a family stranded on a distant planet and a rescue mission sent to save them, all set in a universe where different regions of space have varying levels of technology and intelligence.

books.name: The Diamond Age
books.author: Neal Stephenson
books.description: The novel explores a future world where nanotechnology has become a part of everyday life, following a young girl who comes into possession of an interactive book.

books.name: The Time Machine
books.author: H.G. Wells
books.description: A novella that introduced the concept of time travel, telling the story of an inventor who travels to the distant future.

books.name: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.description: The story of a father and his young son, journeying across a barren, post-apocalyptic landscape, struggling to survive.

books.description: Set in a future where consciousness can be transferred to different bodies, the novel follows a former soldier investigating a rich man's apparent suicide.

books.name: Hyperion
books.author: Dan Simmons
books.description: The novel follows seven pilgrims as they set forth on a journey to the distant world of Hyperion, where each of them hopes to solve their personal dilemmas.

books.name: Blindsight
books.author: Peter Watts
books.description: A novel that explores the nature of consciousness and the limits of human cognition as a crew is sent to investigate an alien signal from the edge of the solar system.

books.name: The Three-Body Problem
books.author: Liu Cixin
books.description: Set against the backdrop of China's Cultural Revolution, the story follows a secret military project that sends signals into space to establish contact with aliens.

books.name: The Forever War
books.author: Joe Haldeman
books.description: The novel follows the story of soldiers fighting an interstellar war between humanity and the alien Taurans.

books.name: Gateway
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.description: The novel is set around an abandoned alien space station discovered by humans, who use it as a base for exploring the galaxy.

books.name: Perdido Street Station
books.author: China Miéville
books.description: The novel is set in the sprawling city of New Crobuzon and follows a scientist who unwittingly unleashes a powerful and dangerous force.

books.name: Anathem
books.author: Neal Stephenson
books.description: The novel is set in a world where monks live in seclusion and pursue knowledge and scientific study, and follows one such monk who gets caught up in a conflict involving parallel universes.
